intro: Aster artemisiiflorus, commonly known as the golden ragwort, is a flowering plant native to the western United States and parts of Mexico. It is characterized by its yellow to orange flowers that bloom in late summer and early fall. The plant has finely divided, fern-like leaves that are often covered in a fine layer of white hairs. It thrives in dry, rocky habitats and is often found in open woodlands and grasslands. Aster artemisiiflorus is a member of the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is known for its ecological importance to pollinators.
